verses.roman:
sa bhīma-duryodhanayor
gadābhyāṁ yudhyator mṛdhe
vārayiṣyan vinaśanaṁ
jagāma yadu-nandanaḥ

synonyms: saḥ—He, Lord Balarāma; bhīma-duryodhanayoḥ—Bhīma and Duryodhana; gadābhyām—with clubs; yudhyatoḥ—who were fighting; mṛdhe—on the battlefield; vārayiṣyan—intending to stop; vinaśanam—to the battlefield; jagāma—went; yadu—of the Yadus; nandanaḥ—the beloved son (Lord Balarāma).
translation: Wanting to stop the club fight then raging between Bhīma and Duryodhana on the battlefield, Lord Balarāma went to Kurukṣetra.
